results.title: Tell my wife I won't be home for dinner
results.creator_credit: Jack Duncan, Paul Ferguson and Cygnet Guild Communications
results.brief_description: Three case studies demonstrate a variety of examples of common mismanagement of time and their consequences. This film offers guidance on how to recognise ineffective time management and to establish effective time use rules.

results.title: Tell me a story (Canberra) : Digital Storytelling project
results.brief_description: This compilation of eleven stories, created by Canberra locals, was the culmination of ACMI’s ‘Train the trainer’ workshops. The stories, mostly biographical, cover a wide range of topics but are mostly concerned with beloved family members and life changing events.

results.title: Tell England
results.creator_credit: Geoffrey Barkas, Anthony Asquith, H. Bruce Woolfe and British Instructional Films
results.brief_description: This drama, which culminates in the ill-fated Gallipoli campaign, follows the fortunes of two public school friends who become officers. In a film of divided, somewhat confined intentions the actual scenes of battle, imaginatively edited with effective use of sound (also intermittently evident in the rest of the film) bear comparison with counterparts “All quiet on the Western Front” and “Westfront” (1918). But the futility of war theme gives way to the endorsement of the status quo and to more conventional heroics in the British stiff-upper-lip tradition. In the Gallipoli scenes Asquith was greatly assisted by Barkas who had earlier made war record films. Cast includes: Carl Harbord, Tony Bruce, Fay Compton.

results.title: Television: how it works!
results.creator_credit: John Smart and Coronet Instructional Films
results.brief_description: The fundamentals of television broadcasting and reception are shown from transmission by electron beams in a camera to the image on a television screen. Includes operation of a cathode ray tube, an electron gun, deflecting coils, and a synogenerator.

results.title: Television: behind the scenes
results.brief_description: The number of television licenses in the Federal Republic of Germany has passed the ten million mark. This film takes a look behind the scenes and shows, apart from the technical details, interesting facts about the production of television programs.

results.title: Television violence and children
results.brief_description: Does television violence have an effect on children? This is one of many questions asked of a panel of experts on a subject of concern to parents and teachers. Includes interviews with Dr T Radecky, Chairman of the USA based National Coalition Against Violence. No other credits available.

results.title: Television system
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basic Television”
Explains the principles of television broadcasting, from the camera tube at the studio to the receiver. Shows how the image is brokenm down into picture elements, clarifies the procedure of interfacing; explains the function of each component of the video signal, shows how the scanning raster is produced and the image reproduced in shades of black and white on the screen.

results.title: Television reporter
results.brief_description: SUMMARY: John C. Schultz spends one working day with John Teague, a television reporter, and portrays the complexities the latter encounters in preparing a news broadcast. Teague explains his techniques at each step in the evolution of a TV news story. Al

results.title: Television receivers
results.creator_credit: Loucks and Norling Studios and McGraw-Hill Text-Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basic Television”
Diagrams and live action are used to identify the sections of the receiver circuit and to summarise the functions of the receiver. Explains the specific functions of each section in a typical intercarrier sound receiver circuit, from the antenna and transmission line to the picture tube.
